name: PerformanceCenterTesting
description: Run a LoadRunner Enterprise test from a task in a Azure DevOps / Microsoft Team Foundation Server CI build process.
author: Micro-Focus

inputs.name: varPCServer
inputs.label: LRE server and port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the hostname or IP address and port of a LoadRunner Enterprise server in the format: http(s)://(LREServer):(port#). If you are required to use a tenant, use the following format: http(s)://(LREServer):(port#)/?tenant=(guid#). For example: https://MyLreServer.MyCompanyDomain.com:444/?tenant=fa128c06-5436-413d-9cfa-9f04bb738df3

inputs.name: varUseTokenForAuthentication
inputs.label: Authenticate with token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Turn on this option to use an LRE token for authentication (an ID key and Secret key can be issued to a user from LRE 2021 R1). This option is the only way of authentication for LRE servers configured with SSO.

inputs.name: varUserName
inputs.label: User name \ Id key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the user name or the Id key of your token access to connect to the LoadRunner Enterprise server.

inputs.name: varPassWord
inputs.label: Password \ Secret key
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Enter the password or Secret key of your token to connect to the LoadRunner Enterprise server.

Note: You can create a variable of type secret in the CI build to store the password, and specify the variable to avoid exposing a password in the build configuration. For example, '$(PCPassword)').

inputs.name: varDomain
inputs.label: Domain
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the LoadRunner Enterprise domain in which the test to run is stored.

inputs.name: varProject
inputs.label: Project
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the name of the LoadRunner Enterprise project in which the test to run is stored.

inputs.name: varTestID
inputs.label: Test ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Test ID. You can get the ID from LoadRunner Enterprise Application > Test Management > Test Plan > Select your test and find the ID in the General Details: Test Name (Id).

inputs.name: varAutoTestInstance
inputs.label: Test instance
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select an option for adding the Test Instance ID:

  • Automatically select existing or create new if none exists. If you select this option, LoadRunner Enterprise creates a test instance or locates the existing test instance.
  • Manual selection. Enter the Test Instance ID (available from LoadRunner Enterprise Application > Test Management > Test Lab > Performance Test Set view).

options.true: Automatically select existing or create new if none exists

inputs.name: varTestInstID
inputs.label: Test Instance ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the Test Instance ID (available from LoadRunner Enterprise > Test Management > Test Lab > Performance Test Set view).

inputs.name: varProxyUrl
inputs.label: Proxy URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Add your local proxy in the format http(s)://(host):(port#) or leave empty if not using a local proxy.

inputs.name: varProxyUser
inputs.label: Proxy user
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you use a proxy requiring credentials, enter the user name.

inputs.name: varProxyPassword
inputs.label: Proxy password
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If you use a proxy requiring credentials, enter the password.

Note: You can create a variable of type secret in the CI build to store the password, and specify the variable to avoid exposing a password in the build configuration. For example, '$(ProxyPassword)').

inputs.name: varPostRunAction
inputs.label: Post Run Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose an action to perform when the run is finished: Collate Results, Collate and Analyze, or Do Not Collate.

inputs.name: varTrending
inputs.label: Trending
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select a trend report option:

  • Do Not Trend. No trend report is created.
  • Use trend report associated with the test. If Auto Trending is selected in the Load Test, select this option to automatically publish trend results.
  • Add run to trend report with ID. If you select this option, enter the trend report ID.

options.AssociatedTrend: Use trend report associated with the test
options.UseTrendReportID: Add run to trend report with ID

inputs.name: varTrendReportID
inputs.label: Trend report ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the trend report ID.

inputs.name: varTimeslotDuration
inputs.label: Timeslot Duration
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter a duration for the Ad-Hoc timeslot (in minutes). The minimum time is 30 minutes. Maximum: 480 hours

inputs.name: varUseVUDs
inputs.label: Use VUDs
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Choose whether to use a Virtual User Day (VUD) license. This provides you with a specified number of Vusers (VUDs) that you can run an unlimited number of times within a 24 hour period.

Before using this option, make sure that VUDs licenses are applied in your LoadRunner Enterprise environment.

inputs.name: varUseSLAInStatus
inputs.label: Status according to SLA
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Select this option to set the build-step status according to a predefined SLA (Service Level Agreement) configured within your performance test.

If you do not select this option, the build-step will be labeled as "Passed" as long as no failures occurred.

inputs.name: vartimeslotRepeat
inputs.label: On Timeslot creation failure
inputs.helpMarkDown:
If the timeslot cannot be created:

  • Do not repeat: the task ends.
  • Repeat with the following parameters: the task will try several times (according to the value set in the 'Number of attempts'parameter below) to recreate the timeslot in order to run the test once again. The task will wait a fixed delay (according to the value set to the 'Delay between attempts' parameter below) between each failing attempt and the next attempt.

inputs.name: varTimeslotRepeatDelay
inputs.label: Delay between attempts
inputs.helpMarkDown: Time (in minutes) to wait between a failed attempt and the next attempt (the minimum is 1 and the maximum is 10).

inputs.name: varTimeslotRepeatAttempts
inputs.label: Number of attempts
inputs.helpMarkDown: How many attempts to run the test (the minimum is 2 and the maximum is 10).

inputs.name: varArtifactsDir
inputs.label: Artifacts directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter the path to the artifacts directory where the result files are stored.
